intro: Acrolepis ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty acrolepis, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Acrolepis ferruginea is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for cultivation in xerophytic gardens.
